author: wsjcom
title: Why Is Such Sensible Advice Labeled Racist?
text:
Regarding Wendy Wang’s “‘The Sequence’ Is the Secret to Success” (op-ed, March 28): When my wife was a young woman, her Lithuanian immigrant grandmother, who started life very poor, asked the same three questions in the same order every time they met. When are you going to finish school? When are you going to get a job? When are you going to get married? Maybe this is why the grandchildren rose to the middle class.
James G. Russell
...
